com.pyramidacceptors.ptalk.api

Class PyramidPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pyramidacceptors.ptalk.api.PyramidPort

  • public final class PyramidPort
extends java.lang.Object
    A PyramidPort is an abstraction of jssc.SerialPort. This
    a set of wrapper functions that implement a serial port specifically
    configured for pyramid devices and protocols.

    Since:
    1.0.0.0
    See Also:
    SerialPort

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String[] getPortList()
      Retrieve a list of ports available to the host OS
      static java.lang.String[] getPortList(java.util.regex.Pattern pattern)
      Retrieve a list of ports with names matching the given Regex pattern

      static java.lang.String[] getPortList(java.util.regex.Pattern pattern, java.lang.String filter)
      Retrieve a list of ports with names matching the given Regex pattern AND
      ports that reside on the given path.
      This is ignored on Windows
      For *nix style systems you may use a path such as "/dev" or "/dev/term"
      static java.lang.String[] getPortList(java.lang.String filter)
      Retrieve a list of ports available on the given path (filter).
      This is ignored on Windows
      For *nix style systems you may use a path such as "/dev" or "/dev/term"

        Retrieve a list of ports available to the host OS

      • getPortList

        public static java.lang.String[] getPortList(java.lang.String filter)
        Retrieve a list of ports available on the given path (filter).
        This is ignored on Windows
        For *nix style systems you may use a path such as "/dev" or "/dev/term"

        Parameters:
        filter - string is the path to search for ports
        Returns:
        String[] list of port names

      • getPortList

        public static java.lang.String[] getPortList(java.util.regex.Pattern pattern)
        Retrieve a list of ports with names matching the given Regex pattern

        Parameters:
        pattern - Regex to search for port names
        Returns:
        String[] list of port names

      • getPortList

        public static java.lang.String[] getPortList(java.util.regex.Pattern pattern,
                             java.lang.String filter)
        Retrieve a list of ports with names matching the given Regex pattern AND
        ports that reside on the given path.
        This is ignored on Windows
        For *nix style systems you may use a path such as "/dev" or "/dev/term"

        Parameters:
        pattern - Regex pattern to search for port names
        filter - String is the path to search for ports
        Returns:
        String[] list of port names
